title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic (Licensing of 

Drivers) (Amendment) (No. 4) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Principal Regulations shall be construed 

together.

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“applicable period” means the period beginning on 1 March 2020 and 
ending on 30 June 2020; 

 “Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) 
Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006).
text_norm: 2 regulation - applicable period mean period beginning 1 march 2020 ending 30 june 2020 principal regulation mean road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i no 537 2006)

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 3. Where the date of expiry of a driving licence granted in accordance with
text_raw:
3. Where the date of expiry of a driving licence granted in accordance with 
Regulation 10 of the Principal Regulations occurs during the applicable period, 
the driving licence shall be deemed to have been granted for an additional period 
of 4 months and the date of expiry shall be 4 months after the date of expiry 
specified on the licence.
text_norm: 3 date expiry driving licence granted accordance regulation 10 principal regulation occurs applicable period driving licence shall deemed granted additional period 4 month date expiry shall 4 month date expiry specified licence

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 4. Where a driving licence, granted in accordance with Regulation 10 of the
text_raw:
4. Where a driving licence, granted in accordance with Regulation 10 of the 
Principal Regulations, is a licence to drive vehicles of more than one category 
and a category is valid to a date that occurs during the applicable period, the 
driving licence in respect of the category concerned shall be deemed to have 
been granted for an additional period of 4 months and its period of validity shall 
be extended by 4 months. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [127] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
9 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport.

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) to provide that a driving licence that expires during 
the period beginning on the 1 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020 is 
extended for an additional period of 4 months from the date of expiry. This 
extension applies to all the categories listed on the licence from the date of expiry 
for each category. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [127] 5
